info.name: /login endpoint tests [GitHub Actions]
info.description:
Collection of tests for endpoint /login of the GAD application.

Description of the test is available in the "Overview" tab of the individual test folders.

Documentation of the GAD application available at:  
[https://github.com/jaktestowac/gad-gui-api-demo](https://github.com/jaktestowac/gad-gui-api-demo)

item.name: Login | Positive tests
Receives user token using valid credentials

exec: pm.test("Response is in JSON format", function () {
pm.test("Response has the required field - access_token", function () {
//second way to check the presence of a property token:
pm.test("Data type of field - access_token is a string", function () {
pm.test("access_token is a non-empty string", function () {
//setting the exact moment of generating a new token

response.name: Receives user token using valid credentials

item.description:
Scenario: Successful user login  
Given: the request body contains a registered user's email and correct password  
When: I send a POST request to the /login endpoint  
Then: the response status should be 200  
And: the response should contain an authentication token

item.name: Validate token | Positive tests
Logged in user has a valid token

exec: //importing a library for date and time management
console.info("Access token is empty or expired. Getting new token...")
console.log("Token successfully generated and saved in environment variables.");

response.name: Logged in user has a valid token

item.description:
Scenario: Successful recognition of an active token as valid  
Given: a valid bearer token in the "Authorization" header  
When: I send a GET request to the /login endpoint  
Then: the response status should be 200

item.name: Validate wrong token | Negative tests

exec: pm.test("The error message is 'Access token is invalid!'", function () {
pm.test("The error message is correct", function () {

item.description:
Scenario: Recognition of a wrong token as invalid  
Given: an invalid bearer token in the "Authorization" header  
When: I send a GET request to the /login endpoint  
Then: the response status should be 401  
And: the response should contain an appropriate error message

item.name: Failed login request with wrong method | Negative tests
item.description:
Scenario: Request with an unsupported method to /login fails  
Given: a request body with a registered user's email and correct password  
When: I send a request other than POST or GET to the /login endpoint  
Then: the response status should be 404

exec: pm.test("Response does not contain any data", function () {

item.name: Malformed request body | Negative tests

body.raw:
This is a Heading

This is a paragraph.

item.description:
Scenario: Request fails due to broken JSON  
Given: a request body with broken JSON  
When: I send a POST request to the /login endpoint  
Then: the response status should be 400

exec: pm.test("The error message is correct", function () {
pm.expect(pm.response.json().error).to.equal("SyntaxError: Unexpected data in JSON. Please check Your JSON.");

item.description:
Scenario: Login fails due to malformed request body  
Given: a request body with an incorrect structure  
When: I send a POST request to the /login endpoint  
Then: the response status should be 401  
And: the response should contain 'Incorrect email or password' message
